I don't mind your odd behaviour
It's the very thing I savour
If you were an ice cream flavour
You would be my favourite one 

My imagination sees you
Like a painting by Van Gogh
Starry nights and bright sunflowers
Follow you where you may go 

Oh, I've loved you from the start
In every single way
And more each passing day
You are brighter than the stars
Believe me when I say
It's not about your scars
It's all about your heart 

You're a butterfly held captive
Small and safe in your cocoon
Go on you can take your time
Time is said to heal all wounds 

Like a lock without a key
Like a mystery without a clue
There is no me if I cannot have you

Mindy Gledhill

People are illogical, unreasonable, and self-centered.
Love them anyway.

If you do good, people will accuse you of selfish ulterior motives.
Do good anyway.

If you are successful, you will win false friends and true enemies.
Succeed anyway.

The good you do today will be forgotten tomorrow.
Do good anyway.

Honesty and frankness make you vulnerable.
Be honest and frank anyway.

The biggest men and women with the biggest ideas can be shot down by the smallest men and women with the smallest minds.
Think big anyway.

People favor underdogs but follow only top dogs.
Fight for a few underdogs anyway.

What you spend years building may be destroyed overnight.
Build anyway.

People really need help but may attack you if you do help them.
Help people anyway.

Give the world the best you have and you'll get kicked in the teeth.
Give the world the best you have anyway.

-The Paradoxical Commandments

Catcher In The Rye: Futility of Life.

Being better than the rest does not make you special, 
It makes you everyone's benchmark.
Being the apple of one's eye does not make you special, 
It makes you just an object of desire.
Being a goof or a clown does not make you special,
It makes you weird.
Being a jack of all traits does not make you special, 
It changes your name; you're jacked!
Being a dreamer of grandeur does not make you special,
It makes you just a dreamer
Working out these dreams does not make you any more special, 
It makes you a visionary, just like many.
What's really special is that out there in this world 
Where many are similar and different in an infinite number of ways,
 My God loves me, even though I'm just an ordinary girl.
I don't have to be smart, crazy, pretty, cool or a winner, 
I can just be Me.

The happiness which brings enduring worth to life 
Is not the superficial happiness that is dependent on
Circumstances. It is the happiness and contentment 
That fills the soul even in the midst of the most distressing
Circumstances and the most bitter environment.
It is the kind of happiness that grins when things go wrong 
And smiles through the tears. The happiness for which our
Souls ache is one undisturbed by success or failure,
One which will root deeply inside us and give inward
Relaxation, peace and contentment, no matter what 
The surface problems might be. That kind of happiness 
Stands in need of no outward stimulus.

-Billy Graham

I've gotta a lot of things to do tonight
I'm so sick of making lists
Of things I'll never finish
I've lived here for the last 12 years
Since early 1995 and all my shit has been in boxes
But if I had a little more time to kill
I'd settle every little stupid thing
Yea, you think that I would
But I'm too tired to go to sleep tonight
And I'm too weak to follow dreams tonight
For the first time in a long time 
I can tell you that I wanna try to get better
and overcome each moment 
In my own way
I wonder if I'll ever lose my mind
I tried hard for a while
But then I kinda gave up
Winter is a killer as the sun goes down
"I'm really not as stubborn as I seem."
Said the knuckle to the concrete.
But I'm too tired to go to sleep tonight
And I'm too weak to follow dreams tonight
For the first time in a long time
I can tell you that I wanna try
To get better and overcome each moment
In my own way
I'm not saying that I'm giving up
I'm just trying not to think
As much as I used to
Cause never is a lonely little messed up word
Maybe I'll get it right some day
For the first time in a long time I can tell you
That I wanna try
I feel helpless for the most part
But I'm learning to open my eyes
And the sad truth of the matter is
I'll never get over it
But I'm gonna try to get better
And overcome each moment
In my own way
I sure want to get back on track
And I'll do whatever it takes 
Even if it kills me.

I believe blogs are made because of someone or something. 
I read my first entry to see who or what has inspired me to create What Steph Said and I realised it was created when Adee was in Indo for a
holiday and I had no crazy pal to blab my nonsense to. Hehehe.
So special thanks to Adee, for her absence resulted in me to put my thoughts into words, my life into pictures.
As I look back at what I've been doing this year so far, I look back at myself wasting my time and blowing opportunities, opportunities to live 
it right and change. I've been super self-seeking, selfish and self-absorbed. When I think about what has been on my mind for the longest time,
I am annoyed that I allow myself to be so distracted.
Now, without any more hesitation or procrastination, I have to live it right!! 
Time is limited and seconds are not something I want to take lightly any more.
I wish the people I love will also not take their lives lightly and remember that life is so very fragile!
Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, watch me try but falter, run but fall along the way but most importantly watch me pick myself up and I know God leads me every step of the way even when I stubbornly close my eyes and think I've got it right sometimes.

Our GP teacher wants us to start blogging and live successfully happily ever after or fail and go to jail so here is my first post in my attempt to live succesfully ever after. Here goes:

Sometimes I think too much and all of  my thoughts are really different from each one, they're all jumbled up ready to be rounded and lost as marbles. Then again, ain't it normal to think you're going crazy sometimes.

What causes madness?

Environment + Genes
Mental disorders can arise from a combination of sources. In many cases there is no single accepted or consistent cause currently established. A common belief even to this day is that disorders result from genetic vulnerabilities exposed by environmental stressors. (see Diathesis-stress model). However, it is clear enough from a simple statistical analysis across the whole spectrum of mental health disorders at least in western cultures that there is a strong relationship between the various forms of severe and complex mental disorder in adulthood and the abuse (physical, sexual or emotional) or neglect of children during the developmental years. Child sexual abuse alone plays a significant role in the causation of a significant percentage of all mental disorders in adult females, most notable examples being eating disorders and borderline personality disorder.
Studies have indicated that genes often play an important role in the development of mental disorders, although the reliable identification of connections between specific genes and specific categories of disorder has proven more difficult. Environmental events surrounding pregnancy and birth have also been implicated. Traumatic brain injury may increase the risk of developing certain mental disorders. There have been some tentative inconsistent links found to certain viral infections, to substance misuse, and to general physical health.

Social influences
Social influences have been found to be important, including abuse, bullying and other negative or stressful life experiences. The specific risks and pathways to particular disorders are less clear, however. Aspects of the wider community have also been implicated, including employment problems, socioeconomic inequality, lack of social cohesion, problems linked to migration, and features of particular societies and cultures.
The mind is deceit and treachery contained within its own delusions and illusions. Our mind is both our best friend and our greatest adversary.

Our mind is something we all have control over and it is matter of choice how we want to use our minds.

Ogay, I cheated and copied all the points above from wiki except the last quote which I strongly believe in.
Hardeeharharhar, sometimes I think it's real cool to be a little crazy at times but I know I've gotta move on to greater things in life and use my mind for excellence.

Philippians 4:8

Yesterday, Patience and I hit the streets of Haji lane. 
(Climbed many creaky staircases, zoomed pass many sweet-smelling flavoured smoke, gave toothy grins to nice shopkeepers!!)
I wanna start drawing start exploring stop talking and start listening start reading.
Start living stop sleeping stop dreaming stop planning start doing start thinking.

We talked about history and about how most of us grew up in church and knew each other since two cells old.
But even though I did, I cannot remember how my friendships with some of them began.
Patience did not grow up in Bethany but I remember the first time I talked to her - it was during YPG!
( So Pae, history's not all that important )
I've realised how much I forget old friends when I move on to new phases of my life.
Old friends were people that gave me smiles before.
If I don't take the time to catch up with them, I won't have the chance to give them any smiles or be a blessing to them!
( So I guess my history's really important to me)

I've thought about it. Why do I want to be a blessing to others and why is Patience really important to me?
It all comes down to His Story.
He is the foundation of all my treasured relationships and I hope whoever's reading this will want to find out more.
Next week, my church will be sharing with you His Story through the Easter musical.
Send me a msg if you wanna find out more.
Good night/morning World!

I'm so tired and weary and I guess I'm not really that strong after all. In fact, if I carefully reflect upon all that I am and have been, I realised that I don't even face up to Mr or Mrs Problems but succumb to my run-away plans, avoid or put my head in the ground and pretend Mr or Mrs Problems isn't there. And now, I'm still as weak as before, still an escapist.

"He gives power to the weak,
And to those who have no might He increases strength.
Even the youths shall faint and be weary,
And the young man shall utterly fall,
But those who wait on the LORD
Shall renew their strength;
They shall mount up with wings like eagles,
They shall run and not be weary,
They shall walk and not faint."
Isaiah 39:29-31

I need to recognise that I'll always be this weak if i rely on my own strength but have the power in God's wings of protection.

I'm really excited for this new year!
New challenges, new lessons to be learnt, new people, probably a new Steph but the same old God!

"I am the First and I am the Last; Besides Me there is no God."
Isaiah 44; 6c

I still remember how lost I felt at the beginning of last year and how God has always been there for me before that, ever since and even now.

"I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go; I will guide you with My eye."
Psalm 32:9

I hope in whatever circumstances whether in tears or with smiles, I will always go back to God as I know He is my Instructor, Teacher and Guide.

It is easy enough to be pleasant,
When life flows by like a song,
But the man worth while is one who will smile,
When everything goes wrong.
For the test of the heart is trouble,
And it always comes with the years.
And the smile that is worth the praises of earth
Is the smile that shines through tears.

It is easy emough to be prudent,
When nothing tempts you to stray,
When without or within no voice of sin
Is luring your soul away:
But it's only a negative virtue
Until it is tried by fire,
And the life that is worth the honour on earth
Is the one that resists desire.

By the cynic, the sad, the fallen
Who had no strength for the strife,
The world's highway is encumbered today,
They make the sum of life.
But the virtue that conquers passon,
And the sorrow that hides in a smile,
It is these that are worth the human on earth
For we find them but once in a while.

Ella Wheeler Wilcox

(love song, with two goldfish)

(He's a drifter, always
floating around her, has
nowhere else to go. He wishes
she would sing, not much, just the scales;
or take some notice,
give him the fish eye.)

(Bounded by round walls
she makes fish eyes
and kissy lips at him, darts
behind pebbles, swallows
his charms hook, line and sinker)

(He's bowled over. He would
take her to the ocean, they could
count the waves. There,
in the submarine silence, they would share
their deepest secrets. Dive for pearls
like stars.)

(But her love's since
gone belly-up. His heart sinks
like a fish. He drinks
like a stone. Drowns those sorrows,
stares emptily through glass.)

(the reason, she said
she wanted)
(and he could not give)
a life
beyond the
(bowl)

 


 

 

By Grace Chua
